head.name: TAN keywords for types of relationships
head.desc: Definitive list of key terms used for describing relationships between digital files.

item.name: auxiliary
item.desc: Digital or nondigital entity that was helpful in creating or editing the present file. This may be useful for crediting a helpful starting point.

item.name: stylesheet
transformation
item.desc: XSLT or XQuery document that was used to create the current TAN document.

group.name: TAN files
group.desc: Relationships where the parent <see-also> must point exclusively to TAN files:

item.name: class 2
dependent
item.desc: Points to a TAN file that uses the current file as a source.

group.name: TAN-c
group.desc: Relationships where the parent <see-also> must point exclusively to the TAN-c format.

item.name: context
item.desc: Background information about one or more concepts mentioned in a TAN file.

group.name: copies
group.desc: Relationships where the parent <see-also> points to a file that is a duplicate of the current document. Used primarily by class 1 files that need to reflect different ways of structuring or presenting the same text.

item.name: alternatively divided edition
alternatively divided copy
alternatively segmented edition
alternatively segmented copy
resegmented copy
item.desc: Used by a class 1 file to point to another class 1 file that contains the identical transcription for the same version of the same work on the same textual object, but divides that transcription into a different reference system. If this value is invoked, the text-joined text content of <body> must be identical, following TAN rules for joining leaf divs. This <relationship> is useful for developing a concordance between alternative reference systems for the same text.

group.name: versions
group.desc: Relationships where the parent <see-also> must point to another version of the current TAN file or its underlying work.

item.name: old version
item.desc: TAN file superseded by the present file, and part of the same editorial stream. The alterations are considered not to warrant a new @id in the rootmost element.

item.name: new version
update
item.desc: TAN file that supersedes the present file, and part of the same editorial stream. The alterations have not been significant enough to warrant a new @id in the rootmost element. This is useful for officially deprecating a TAN file without deleting it.

item.name: different work version
item.desc: Used by a class 1 TAN file to point to another that offers the same work but in a different version.

item.name: model
